nlu_benchmarker¶

cancel()[source]¶

Abort the benchmark gracefully in the next situation possible.

Return type

None

classmethod confusionMatrixToF1Scores(confusion_matrix)[source]¶
Parameters

confusion_matrix (Dict[Optional[str], Dict[Optional[str], int]]) – The confusion matrix to calculate F1 scores from.

Return type

Dict[Optional[str], float]

Returns

A mapping from intents to their respective F1 scores.

async run(frameworks, data_sets, num_iterations)[source]¶

Measure the performance of each framework on each data set. Outputs a summary about which framework performed best on each data set; also generates charts with more details about all performances.

This method guarantees that all frameworks are destroyed before returning.

Parameters

  • frameworks (List[NLUFramework]) – The frameworks to benchmark.

  • data_sets (List[NLUDataSet]) – The data sets to benchmark on.

  • num_iterations (int) – The number of iterations to repeat the evaluation process. The result is the average over all iterations.

Return type

None

async createFrameworks(global_config, framework_configs)[source]¶

Create and prepare NLUFramework s based on configuration dictionaries.

This method guarantees that either all frameworks are created or none of them. That means, if something goes wrong in the progress, frameworks that already were created are destroyed again.

Parameters

  • global_config (GlobalConfig) – Global configuration for the whole test framework.

  • framework_configs (Dict[str, Union[List[Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], Dict[str, Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], str, int, float, bool, None]]) – A dictionary containing the configuration of the frameworks to create. See Framework Configuration for more information.

Raises

ParallelException – if at least one framework creation failed.

Return type

List[NLUFramework]

static loadDataSets(configs, global_ignore_cache=False)[source]¶

Load data sets based on the configuration dictionary.

Parameters

  • configs (Dict[str, Union[List[Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], Dict[str, Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], str, int, float, bool, None]]) – A dictionary containing the configuration of the data sets to load. See Data Set Configuration for more information.

  • global_ignore_cache (bool) – A boolean indicating whether caches should be ignored globally. Defaults to False.

Return type

List[NLUDataSet]

async runFromConfig(config, **global_config_override)[source]¶

Load and run a full benchmark from a single configuration dictionary.

Parameters

  • config (Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[List[Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], Dict[str, Union[List[ForwardRef], Dict[str, ForwardRef], str, int, float, bool, None]], str, int, float, bool, None]]]) – A dictionary containing the full configuration required to load and run the benchmark. See Full Configuration for more information.

  • **global_config_override – Options to override in the global configuration.

Return type

None

async runFromConfigFile(path, **global_config_override)[source]¶

Load and run a full benchmark from a configuration file.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The path to the configuration file. See Configuration Files for more information.

  • **global_config_override – Options to override in the global configuration.

Raises

  • OSError – in case the config file could not be read due to I/O or other OS-related issues.

  • yaml.YAMLError – in case the config file contains invalid YAML.

Return type

None
